Job Title: Director, Change Management - Remote

Location: Colfax, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Logistics at full potential. 

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.

The Director, Change Management, is a new role that will be responsible for developing a change management methodology and process for GXO. This individual will introduce a strong discipline of change practices, using a highly consultative and execution-focused mindset, bringing extensive expertise in building, leading and upskilling change management and introducing best practice frameworks and strategies. In addition, this role will be responsible for assessing readiness and change needs, developing change management strategies, developing plans, and leading the change management activities for GXO’s Americas and Asia Pacific (AMAPAC) HR Organization. This individual will work with world-class cross-functional teams to support execution and facilitate a collaborative environment that is inclusive and productive. This role will be focused on enhancing and promoting a culture based on the organization’s unifying values, and ethical decision-making.

Responsibilities


Partner with other regions to drive and develop an overall Change Management Strategy, Process, Approach, and playbook for GXOPlan and deliver change management projects for the AMAPAC regionEnsure visibility of change management projects and keep leadership up to date on progress, risks and known issues.Develop communication strategies and simultaneously execute a variety of tactics to reach all relevant stakeholders with timely and consistent information related to project updates, key announcements, policy and process changes, organizational changes and be able to organize - and often visualize - strategies in a variety of formats to ensure understanding of responsibilities and timelines.Identify factors that could jeopardize realization of critically important change endeavors. Develop and execute risk mitigation plans.Oversee day-to-day operations and applying structured methodology to lead change management activities.Assess, develop, and execute a culture framework aimed at managing business results including employee morale and retention.Evaluate the effectiveness of the change management program and implement improvement strategies.Provide consulting and oversight to ensure organizational change is effectively managed.Facilitate and lead workshops and meetings to identify, plan, and implement change initiatives.Identify leading practices that can be deployed across the enterprise, upskilling and building a team of Talent and Change leads, and building enterprise manager and employee change leadership, readiness and resilience.Develop key performance indicators; analyze and interpret overall performance and track key business development objectives and strategic initiatives.


Required Skills/Abilities: 


Deft interpersonal skills for communicating with all levels of staff and diverse individuals and groups.Ability to problem solve, manage conflict, and build relationships with people at all levels of the organization.Data-driven and results-orientedEnergetic, decisive, and creative forward thinker.


Education and Experience: 


Bachelor’s degree and equivalent experience in industry required; Master’s degree in organizational psychology strongly preferred.Seven to ten (7-10) years in human resources, organizational development and effectiveness, leadership development, I/O psychology or related field with strong, proven change management expertise; management consulting experience preferred.Established Change Management/Organizational Development practitioner with demonstrated skill and experience working on large scale engagements with significant change elements and delivering behavioral transformation.Ability to apply industry experience and next level change management and organizational development thinking.Adept at learning the business, creating internal partnerships, fostering collaboration and recommending strategies that fit the culture and business model.Relevant experience assisting organizational transformation and change efforts within a large company setting, with a solid understanding of the drivers of organizational culture and climates.Proven thought leader who consistently educates themselves on latest thinking and advances in the space, external trends and competitor analysis. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership.Experience leading change management for large-scale, multi-country initiatives.


It'd be great if you also have: 


Experience working on M&A transactions, including acquisition integrationGlobal experienceProven track record of developing and implementing action-oriented innovative models of practice, approach, and policy for promoting culture changes, strengthening organizations and workplace environments.Demonstrated ability to track, manage and handle significant volumes of information involving different issues with keen attention to detail.


GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.

GXO adheres to CDC, OSHA and state and local requirements regarding COVID safety. All employees and visitors are expected to comply with GXO policies which are in place to safeguard our employees and customers.

All applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to take and pass a pre-employment drug test.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

Experience Level (if available): Director
